verses.verse: They continued<WH3427> three<WH7969> years<WH8141> without war<WH4421> between Syria<WH758> and Israel.<WH3478>
It happened in the third<WH7992> year,<WH8141> that Jehoshaphat<WH3092> the king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> came down<WH3381> to the king<WH4428> of Israel.<WH3478>

The king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> to his servants,<WH5650> "You know<WH3045> that Ramoth<WH7433> Gilead<WH1568> is ours,<WH2814> and we are still, and don't<WH3947> take it out of the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Syria?<WH758>"

He said<WH559> to Jehoshaphat,<WH3092> "Will you go<WH3212> with me to battle<WH4421> to Ramoth Gilead?<WH7433>" Jehoshaphat<WH3092> said<WH559> to the king<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> "I am as you<WH3644> are,<WH5971> my people as your people,<WH5971> my horses<WH5483> as your horses.<WH5483>"
Jehoshaphat<WH3092> said<WH559> to the king<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> "Please inquire<WH1875> first<WH3117> for the word<WH1697> of Yahweh.<WH3068>"

Then the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> gathered<WH6908> the prophets<WH5030> together,<WH6908> about four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men,<WH376> and said<WH559> to them,<WH3212> "Shall I go against Ramoth Gilead<WH7433> to battle,<WH4421> or shall I forbear?<WH2308>" They said,<WH559> "Go up;<WH5927> for the Lord<WH136> will deliver<WH5414> it into the hand<WH3027> of the king.<WH4428>"
But Jehoshaphat<WH3092> said,<WH559> "Isn't<WH5030> there here a prophet of Yahweh,<WH3068> that<WH5750> we may inquire of him?<WH1875>"

The king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> to Jehoshaphat,<WH3092> "There is yet one<WH259> man<WH376> by whom we may inquire<WH1875> of Yahweh,<WH3068> Micaiah<WH4321> the son<WH1121> of Imlah;<WH3229> but I hate<WH8130> him;<WH5012> for he does not prophesy good<WH2896> concerning me,<WH7451> but evil." Jehoshaphat<WH3092> said,<WH559> "Don't<WH4428> let the king say so.<WH559>"
Then the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> called<WH7121> an<WH259> officer,<WH5631> and said,<WH559> "Quickly<WH4116> get Micaiah<WH4321> the son<WH1121> of Imlah.<WH3229>"

Now the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> and Jehoshaphat<WH3092> the king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> were sitting<WH3427> each<WH376> on<WH3847> his throne,<WH3678> arrayed<WH3847> in their robes,<WH899> in an open place<WH1637> at the entrance<WH6607> of the gate<WH8179> of Samaria;<WH8111> and all the prophets<WH5030> were prophesying before them.<WH6440>

Zedekiah<WH6667> the son<WH1121> of Chenaanah<WH3668> made<WH6213> him horns<WH7161> of iron,<WH1270> and said,<WH559> "Thus says<WH559> Yahweh,<WH3068> <WH5055> 'With these you shall push the Syrians,<WH758> until they are consumed.<WH3615>'"

All the prophets<WH5030> prophesied<WH5012> so,<WH559> saying, "Go up<WH5927> to Ramoth Gilead,<WH7433> and prosper;<WH6743> for Yahweh<WH3068> will deliver<WH5414> it into the hand<WH3027> of the king.<WH4428>"

The messenger<WH4397> who went<WH1980> to call<WH7121> Micaiah<WH4321> spoke<WH1696> to him,<WH559> saying, "See now,<WH5030> the prophets declare<WH1697> good<WH2896> to the king<WH4428> with one<WH259> mouth.<WH6310> Please let your word<WH1697> be like the word<WH1697> of one<WH259> of them,<WH1696> and speak good.<WH2896>"
Micaiah<WH4321> said,<WH559> "As Yahweh<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> what Yahweh<WH3068> says<WH559> to me,<WH1696> that I will speak."

When he had come<WH935> to the king,<WH4428> the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to him,<WH4321> "Micaiah, shall we go<WH3212> to Ramoth Gilead<WH7433> to battle,<WH4421> or shall we forbear?<WH2308>" He answered<WH559> him,<WH5927> "Go up and prosper;<WH6743> and Yahweh<WH3068> will deliver<WH5414> it into the hand<WH3027> of the king.<WH4428>"
The king<WH4428> said<WH559> to him,<WH6471> "How many times do I have to adjure<WH7650> you that you speak<WH1696> to me nothing but the truth<WH571> in the name<WH8034> of Yahweh?<WH3068>"

He said,<WH559> "I saw<WH7200> all Israel<WH3478> scattered<WH6327> on the mountains,<WH2022> as sheep<WH6629> that have no shepherd.<WH7462> Yahweh<WH3068> said,<WH559> <WH113> 'These have no master. Let them each<WH376> return<WH7725> to his house<WH1004> in peace.<WH7965>'"
The king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> to Jehoshaphat,<WH3092> "Didn't<WH559> I tell you that he would not prophesy<WH5012> good<WH2896> concerning me,<WH7451> but evil?"

Micaiah said,<WH559> "Therefore hear<WH8085> the word<WH1697> of Yahweh.<WH3068> I saw<WH7200> Yahweh<WH3068> sitting<WH3427> on his throne,<WH3678> and all the army<WH6635> of heaven<WH8064> standing<WH5975> by him on his right hand<WH3225> and on his left.<WH8040>

Yahweh<WH3068> said,<WH559> <WH6601> 'Who shall entice Ahab,<WH256> that he may go up<WH5927> and fall<WH5307> at Ramoth Gilead?<WH7433>' One said<WH559> one thing;<WH3541> and another said<WH559> another.<WH3541>
A spirit<WH7307> came out<WH3318> and stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> Yahweh,<WH3068> and said,<WH559> <WH6601> 'I will entice him.'

Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to him,<WH559> 'How?' He said, <WH3318> 'I will go out and will be a lying<WH8267> spirit<WH7307> in the mouth<WH6310> of all his prophets.<WH5030>' He said,<WH559> <WH6601> 'You will entice him,<WH3201> and will also prevail. Go out<WH3318> and do so.<WH6213>'

Now therefore,<WH3068> behold, Yahweh has put<WH5414> a lying<WH8267> spirit<WH7307> in the mouth<WH6310> of all these your prophets;<WH5030> and Yahweh<WH3068> has spoken<WH1696> evil concerning you.<WH7451>"

Then Zedekiah<WH6667> the son<WH1121> of Chenaanah<WH3668> came near,<WH5066> and struck<WH5221> Micaiah<WH4321> on the cheek,<WH3895> and said,<WH559> "Which way<WH335> did the Spirit<WH7307> of Yahweh<WH3068> go<WH5674> from me to speak to you?<WH1696>"
Micaiah<WH4321> said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH7200> you will see on that day,<WH3117> when you go<WH935> into an inner<WH2315> room<WH2315> to hide yourself.<WH2247>"

The king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> said,<WH559> "Take<WH3947> Micaiah,<WH4321> and carry him back<WH7725> to Amon<WH526> the governor<WH8269> of the city,<WH5892> and to Joash<WH3101> the king<WH4428>'s son.<WH1121>

Say,<WH559> <WH559> 'Thus says the king,<WH4428> "Put<WH7760> this fellow in the prison,<WH1004> and feed<WH398> him with bread<WH3899> of affliction<WH3906> and with water<WH4325> of affliction,<WH3906> until I come<WH935> in peace.<WH7965>"'"
Micaiah<WH4321> said,<WH559> "If you return<WH7725> at all<WH7725> in peace,<WH7965> Yahweh<WH3068> has not spoken<WH1696> by me.<WH559>" He said, "Listen,<WH8085> all you people!<WH5971>"
So the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> and Jehoshaphat<WH3092> the king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> went up<WH5927> to Ramoth Gilead.<WH7433>

The king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> to Jehoshaphat,<WH3092> "I will disguise<WH2664> myself,<WH935> and go into the battle;<WH4421> but you put on<WH3847> your robes.<WH899>" The king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> disguised<WH2664> himself,<WH935> and went into the battle.<WH4421>

Now the king<WH4428> of Syria<WH758> had commanded<WH6680> the thirty<WH7970> - two<WH8147> captains<WH8269> of his chariots,<WH7393> saying,<WH559> Fight<WH3898> neither with small<WH6996> nor great,<WH1419> except only with the king<WH4428> of Israel.<WH3478>

It happened,<WH8269> when the captains of the chariots<WH7393> saw<WH7200> Jehoshaphat,<WH3092> that they said,<WH559> "Surely that is the king<WH4428> of Israel!<WH3478>" and they turned aside<WH5493> to fight<WH3898> against him.<WH3092> Jehoshaphat cried out.<WH2199>
It happened,<WH8269> when the captains of the chariots<WH7393> saw<WH7200> that it was not the king<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> that they turned back<WH7725> from pursuing him.<WH310>

A certain man<WH376> drew<WH4900> his bow<WH7198> at random,<WH8537> and struck<WH5221> the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> between the joints<WH1694> of the armor.<WH8302> Therefore he said<WH559> to the driver of his chariot,<WH7395> "Turn<WH2015> your hand,<WH3027> and carry me out<WH3318> of the battle;<WH4264> for I am severely wounded.<WH2470>"

The battle<WH4421> increased<WH5927> that day.<WH3117> The king<WH4428> was propped up<WH5975> in his chariot<WH4818> facing<WH5227> the Syrians,<WH758> and died<WH4191> at evening.<WH6153> The blood<WH1818> ran out<WH3332> of the wound<WH4347> into the bottom<WH2436> of the chariot.<WH7393>

A cry<WH7440> went<WH5674> throughout the army<WH4264> about the going down<WH935> of the sun,<WH8121> saying,<WH559> "Every man<WH376> to his city,<WH5892> and every man<WH376> to his country!<WH776>"
So the king<WH4428> died,<WH4191> and was brought<WH935> to Samaria;<WH8111> and they buried<WH6912> the king<WH4428> in Samaria.<WH8111>

They washed<WH7857> the chariot<WH7393> by the pool<WH1295> of Samaria;<WH8111> and the dogs<WH3611> licked up<WH3952> his blood<WH1818> where the prostitutes washed<WH7364> themselves;<WH2185> according to the word<WH1697> of Yahweh<WH3068> which he spoke.<WH1696>

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Ahab,<WH256> and all that he did,<WH6213> and the ivory<WH8127> house<WH1004> which he built,<WH1129> and all the cities<WH5892> that he built,<WH1129> aren't<WH3789> they written in the book<WH5612> of the chronicles<WH1697> of the kings<WH4428> of Israel?<WH3478>
So Ahab<WH256> slept<WH7901> with his fathers;<WH1> and Ahaziah<WH274> his son<WH1121> reigned in his place.<WH4427>
Jehoshaphat<WH3092> the son<WH1121> of Asa<WH609> began to reign<WH4427> over Judah<WH3063> in the fourth<WH702> year<WH8141> of Ahab<WH256> king<WH4428> of Israel.<WH3478>

Jehoshaphat<WH3092> was thirty<WH7970> - five<WH2568> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he began to reign;<WH4427> and he reigned<WH4427> twenty<WH6242> - five<WH2568> years<WH8141> in Jerusalem.<WH3389> His mother<WH517>'s name<WH8034> was Azubah<WH5806> the daughter<WH1323> of Shilhi.<WH7977>

He walked<WH3212> in all the way<WH1870> of Asa<WH609> his father;<WH1> He didn't<WH5493> turn aside from it,<WH6213> doing that which was right<WH3477> in the eyes<WH5869> of Yahweh:<WH3068> however the high places<WH1116> were not taken away;<WH5493> the people<WH5971> still sacrificed<WH2076> and burnt incense<WH6999> in the high places.<WH1116>
Jehoshaphat<WH3092> made peace<WH7999> with the king<WH4428> of Israel.<WH3478>

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Jehoshaphat,<WH3092> and his might<WH1369> that he showed,<WH6213> and how he warred,<WH3898> aren't<WH3789> they written in the book<WH5612> of the chronicles<WH1697> of the kings<WH4428> of Judah?<WH3063>
The remnant<WH3499> of the sodomites,<WH6945> that remained<WH7604> in the days<WH3117> of his father<WH1> Asa,<WH609> he put away<WH1197> out of the land.<WH776>
There was no king<WH4428> in Edom:<WH123> a deputy<WH5324> was king.<WH4428>

Jehoshaphat<WH3092> made<WH6213> ships<WH591> of Tarshish<WH8659> to go<WH3212> to Ophir<WH211> for gold:<WH2091> but they didn't<WH1980> go; for the ships<WH591> were broken<WH7665> at Ezion Geber.<WH6100>

Then Ahaziah<WH274> the son<WH1121> of Ahab<WH256> said<WH559> to Jehoshaphat,<WH3092> "Let my servants<WH5650> go<WH3212> with your servants<WH5650> in the ships.<WH591>" But Jehoshaphat<WH3092> would not.<WH14>
